sourceMeaningMnemonic: Tying a <radical>thread</radical> to a <radical>tombstone</radical> each year will help you <kanji>manage</kanji> the <kanji>passage of time</kanji>. That way you’ll know how many years you <kanji>pass through</kanji>, since you’ll have one thread for each year to count.
meaningInfo: Picture yourself coming back to the same tombstone each passing year and tying a new thread to it. You're trying to manage these feelings by keeping track of how much time passes.
readingMnemonic: Dealing with the <kanji>passage of time</kanji> can be tough, so after you tie the thread to the tombstone, each year you eat a piece of <reading>ca</reading>ke (<ja>けい</ja>). You already eat cake to mark the passage of time on your birthday, so why not here as well?
readingInfo: Maybe this is your future tombstone, and eating cake each year is a preemptive celebration of your death day! Ooh, what a spooky theory.
